result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
** 2 DAYS CREDIT IF REVOKED**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Caleb I Manning

records.addlTxt: Count 2 to be expunged upon successful completion of probation.
Notice of Pretrial Monitoring Program Termination
Same as Complaint.

Conditions:

See Plea Hearing docket

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

Case called at 10:59 AM.
Defendant Caleb I Manning in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared by video for Caleb I Manning.  Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Agreement has been reached. Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearing.  State to file Information that mirrors the Criminal Complaint within 48 Hours.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1 as charged in the Criminal Complaint as part of a 3 Year DAGP. Court withholds finding of guilt. Charge to be dismissed upon completion of the DAGP.
Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2 as charged in the Information. Sentence is Withheld and the Defendant is placed on 3 Years of Probation with the following conditions:
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. No traffic violations involving the consumption of illegal/controlled substances. Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Court Costs/surcharges. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.  Defendant is granted 2 days of sentence credit.
Count 2 to be expunged upon successful completion of probation.  Court removes the CTC condition from the bond. Defendant ordered to sign new bond.
Deferred Acceptance of a Guilty Plea Agreement - DAGP (signed by all but ADA)
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachments)
Hearing on August 19, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing on August 19, 2022 at 10:45 am.
